items.title: Treeherder Fenix branch is not showing Browsertime tests in the view
items.body:
On the Fenix branch in treeherder, our browsertime tests are no longer showing up in the view even though they did run. It seems to have started around July 29th: https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=fenix&group_state=expanded&resultStatus=testfailed%2Cbusted%2Cexception%2Csuccess%2Cusercancel%2Crunning%2Cpending%2Crunnable&fromchange=e2e684b4d452378cf07c70b00f921afe9b5b687a&searchStr=browsertime
Treeherder

Here's the most recent browsertime test which ran but didn't showup in the treeherder view: https://firefox-ci-tc.services.mozilla.com/tasks/Gcw1BJ1wTTu69A9Uud8NqA

items.title: Create centralized list of jobs that can be referenced throughout
items.body: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1654043

items.title: Support filtering tasks by *manifest* (not test path) path from selected task

milestone.title: manifest-scheduling
milestone.description: This milestone is part of moving to manifest based scheduling in https://github.com/orgs/mozilla/projects/121

items.body: (I split up this issue to *only* show manifests/groups of tests instead of test paths since it is a lot more work) Related bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1636506 UI proving the concept: https://test-paths-for-task.netlify.app The following mock-up allows the developers/sheriffs to see what manifests and test paths executed for a given task. Each listed manifest/test path is a link to the existing view that filters all tasks that executed the same manifest/test path. This solves the problem where a developer/sheriff would look for a failed test path from the logs copy it and use some dropdowns from the UI to filter tasks that have executed the same manifest or test path.

items.title: Test grouping / Layout
items.body: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1649822

items.title: Commits / Progress area
items.body:
Bring this into alignment with the UX mockup

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1647447

items.title: Add button to copy task label
items.body: Add the ability to copy task label, similar to the task ID.

items.title: Push Health should preserve the order of the commit
items.body:
Here, I did a try job:
https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=try&revision=728cf9e9d74ef17b20220c4ca4c2ec74e02aa98f
The order is the following:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/733326/84891654-7efb3300-b09c-11ea-9dad-507ff8dda089.png)

In push health, it seems to be in alphabetical order on the commit hash.
https://treeherder.mozilla.org/pushhealth.html?revision=728cf9e9d74ef17b20220c4ca4c2ec74e02aa98f&repo=try
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/733326/84891707-94705d00-b09c-11ea-89e2-50427e8fcc97.png)

As the order matters, we should preserve it in push health too!

items.title: Add API to treeherder to find which tests belong to which chunk, whether they pass or fail.
items.body: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1636506

items.title: Add Fenix to intermittent-failures.html for ui-test intermittents
items.body:
Hey folks,

I'm wondering if/how Fenix can be accomidated as a tree added to the intermittent-failures.html view (or perhaps some entirely different simplified page)?

The setup for Fenix is of course different than from what one would find in the other trees (issues on Github, labelling, and current manual process for filing intermittent failures). 

https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=fenix

For our team we would be interested in looking at `ui-test opt` [tier 2] failures and treat them as intermittent.  The same graphing would be of interest to us (date of first occurrence, failure count, etc).

I'm curious what kind of support can be added for Fenix, is it possible? If not, I am looking for recommendations on how one might acquire similar data manually then (failure count, first occurrence, etc).

https://treeherder.readthedocs.io/testing.html still mentions runchecks.sh which got removed in #6194.

@shubhank-saxena can you also update the documentation, please?

items.title: Create summary component that shows in the Job-View if a user is looking at a single revision on try.
items.body: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1630712

items.title: Docker: Only ingest data when DB points locally
items.body:
Some developers use DATABASE_URL to point to production databases when doing local development.

Automatic ingestion in the Docker set up can make the local set up ingest into the production systems.

Let's change the code so it only ingest if DATABASE_URL is pointing to localhost.

This is to handle the issues faced by camd in here:
https://github.com/mozilla/treeherder/pull/6295

items.title: Ingesting a task without a push should create the push
items.body:
Currently, trying to ingest a task for a non-existent push fails with `treeherder.etl.exceptions.MissingPushException: No push found in autoland for revision 7c8adbf978a2e4478d2f0c214ef5523cbda3b74a for task OFkqJB4PQ_ultXc5a0dw0g`.

Instead of failing I would like us to place a request in the `store_pulse_pushes` queue and let it be process.

items.title: Failure to load page when parent push not found
items.body: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1628718

items.title: More Pulse changes
items.body:
We now ingest Pulse messages by default on the Docker set up.

We need to change the default queue names to something unique to the user.

Otherwise, developer A and developer B start the docker set up and they will both be consuming from the "resulsets" and "tasks" queues:
https://github.com/mozilla/treeherder/blob/d2d54f857926ab29d0d82a9a47db5a88f90e3aac/treeherder/services/pulse/consumers.py#L168
https://github.com/mozilla/treeherder/blob/d2d54f857926ab29d0d82a9a47db5a88f90e3aac/treeherder/services/pulse/consumers.py#L150

We also need to remove one of the two Pulse container entries in docker-compose.yml and use the new single consuming command `./manage pulse_listener` (both tasks and pushes)

items.title: Execute pre-commit run --all-files
items.body:
Wait for https://github.com/mozilla/treeherder/issues/6190
and for https://github.com/mozilla/treeherder/pull/6277 to land.

The 2nd PR will actually fix the isort hook that causes a lot of files to be changed.

items.title: Add New Relic instrumentation
items.body:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1612229

- [X] How many revisions do we show push health for
- [X] prior to clicking retrigger there were X need-inv.  After retrigger, there were Y need-inv.  Show that stat.

items.title: Improve Expand/Collapse of each metric.
items.body:
This is both for UX and for A11y
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1603171

The fix for this issue is to make the buttons at the top of the page toggle open/close of each of the metrics.  Currently they only open, or scroll the metric into the frame.  The same button should also collapse the metric.

Later, we will not completely hide the metric, just collapse it down to the name only.  But that is beyond the scope of this PR.

    docker-compose exec backend bash

...and run the tests...

```
                failing method ID
```

items.title: isort broken inside docker container
items.body:
`./runchecks.sh` run inside the docker container is broken.  It appears to try and format all files:

it is still ignoring the `setup.cfg`

```
[isort]
skip = __pycache__,node_modules,migrations,misc
skip_glob = */.*/*  # skip_glob uses full path matching, not prefix matching
multi_line_output = 1
force_grid_wrap = true
line_length = 100
```


here is the output
```
Running pip check
No broken requirements found.
Checking CELERY_TASK_QUEUES matches Procfile
Running flake8
Running isort
ERROR: /app/LICENSE.txt Imports are incorrectly sorted.
--- /app/LICENSE.txt:before	2020-02-05 18:35:56.607930
+++ /app/LICENSE.txt:after	2020-03-29 15:40:06.388303
@@ -247,7 +247,8 @@
 Contributor are reinstated on an ongoing basis if such Contributor
 notifies You of the non-compliance by some reasonable means, this is the
 first time You have received notice of non-compliance with this License
-from such Contributor, and You become compliant prior to 30 days after
+from suchContributor import andYoubecomecompliantpriorto30daysafter
+
 Your receipt of the notice.
 
 5.2. If You initiate litigation against any entity by asserting a patent

<SNIP>

ERROR: /app/LICENSE.txt Imports are incorrectly sorted.
--- /app/LICENSE.txt:before	2020-02-05 18:35:56.607930
+++ /app/LICENSE.txt:after	2020-03-29 15:40:18.203369
@@ -247,7 +247,8 @@
 Contributor are reinstated on an ongoing basis if such Contributor
 notifies You of the non-compliance by some reasonable means, this is the
 first time You have received notice of non-compliance with this License
-from such Contributor, and You become compliant prior to 30 days after
+from suchContributor import andYoubecomecompliantpriorto30daysafter
+
 Your receipt of the notice.
 
 5.2. If You initiate litigation against any entity by asserting a patent
```

items.title: Use tox to test similar Python scenarios as in Travis
items.body: Let's first get tox to work locally. Once we're satisfied we can follow up with another PR to switch Travis to using it.

items.title: Merge ingest_push into ingest management command
items.body: Currently there's two scripts we should merge.

items.title: Add check for valid Markdown syntax
items.body:
I believe nothing that prevents us from landing incorrect Markdown code.

We will need to execute this as part of the pre-commit checks as well as within Travis (probably `pre-commit run --all-files <some_markdown_lint_hook>`.

https://pre-commit.com/hooks.html

items.title: Merge both Pulse ingestion commands into one
items.body:
Currently we have two different commands to ingest Pulse data.

Let's merge the two as there's no good reason.

The PR will have to mention [bug 1530965](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1530965) in one of the commits.

items.title: Automatic local ingestion of data
items.body:
Currently we have two Pulse ingestion scripts and three Celery workers in the Procfile. Setting local ingestion requires starting the `backend` Docker container three times following [manual set up steps](https://treeherder.readthedocs.io/installation.html#running-the-ingestion-tasks).

I would like two more entries in the `docker-compose.yml` file for `pulse` and another one for the `celery` worker. They would each have their own different entryfiles.

items.title: isort needs to have enabled with git add .
isort does not behave the same within pre-commit context
items.body:
This means that pre commit checks complain in one way while `isort` inside of the Docker container complains about other issues.

I'm investigating this as it is quite painful.

items.title: Prevent linting issues on Travis
items.body:
In `runtests.sh` we execute `flake8` and `isort`. Unfortunately, a lot of errors are only caught on Travis which require multiple interruptions to development & review.

See https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1610346

items.title: Auto delete Pulse queues
items.body:
[bug 1607561](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1607561)

When a Heroku Review App is deleted the Pulse consumers are destroyred but the Pulse Guardian queues keep growing until they get deleted. Meanwhile, we receive an email alerting us about it and another one when the queue is deleted.

This will also be important for local consumption.

We would like to auto-destroy the queues when there are no consumers left.
RabbitMQ supports a "TTL" [1] feature for queues that will automatically delete them when there are no consumers for a designated time.

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/ttl.html

items.title: Use poetry to serve documentation
items.body:
The steps to set up the docs is in [here](https://treeherder.readthedocs.io/common_tasks.html#serving-the-docs-locally).

Use `poetry` to create a venv and easily serve the docs.

items.title: Recognize ThreadSanitizer "nested bug" abort
items.body:
Whenever ThreadSanitizer hits a bug while handling a bug, it emits the following messages:

```
ThreadSanitizer:DEADLYSIGNAL
ThreadSanitizer: nested bug in the same thread, aborting.
```

It then terminates without a `SUMMARY`, so this condition is not recognized properly by Treeherder. I will add this particular message so sheriffs can more easily star this as intermittent.

items.title: Initialize some defaults for local development
items.body:
In [this PR](BROKER_URL=localhost//guest:guest@rabbitmq//;DATABASE_URL=mysql://root@localhost:3306/treeherder;REDIS_URL=redis://localhost:6379;SITE_URL=http://backend:8000/;TREEHERDER_DEBUG=True;TREEHERDER_DJANGO_SECRET_KEY=secret-key-of-at-least-50-characters-to-pass-check-deploy;NEW_RELIC_DEVELOPER_MODE=True), there are a bunch of env variables that are manually set up:

> BROKER_URL=localhost//guest:guest@rabbitmq//;DATABASE_URL=mysql://root@localhost:3306/treeherder;REDIS_URL=redis://localhost:6379;SITE_URL=http://backend:8000/;TREEHERDER_DEBUG=True;TREEHERDER_DJANGO_SECRET_KEY=secret-key-of-at-least-50-characters-to-pass-check-deploy;NEW_RELIC_DEVELOPER_MODE=True

Let's set up these defaults in `treeherder/config/settings.py`.

STR:
```bash
python3 -m venv venv # This only works for Python 3
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements/common.txt
pip install -r requirements/dev.txt
./manage.py check # This is the step that needs to work
```

items.title: Minimum UI coverage
items.body:
Changes:
- A PR should not be merged if it drops the UI test coverage below 40%
- The [relative coverage change](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta#section-relative) should be greater than 0%
  - This means that new lines added are at least somewhat covered; that way we force ourselves to at leat try to write some tests

As always, administratros can still force a merge if needed.

This issue states to remove NoOpSerializer from serializers.py .

This is a bug in the project which needs to be fixed. I am willing to work on it. @armenzg and @klahnakoski Please guide me on how to proceed with this .

items.title: Add Python test coverage
items.body: Shubhank is interested on taking this.

items.title: Disable lint checks or provide a command to auto-fix all of them
items.body:
My PRs include hours devoted to lint fixes.  Let's provide a way to autofix all lint errors, and disable any lint fixes that can not be auto-fixed.

Passing operational tests should be the only requirement.

items.title: Properly parallelize the manual ingestion code
items.body:
I created a management ingestion code for local development that can ingest all tasks for a push and insert them into the DB.

The code I wrote uses asyncio, however, it does not properly paralelize the process. The way it executes it first prepares each individual task for insertion and it then handles all insertions at once. There's the odd DB insertion while the first part happens.

Here's the script and its timing on my machine:
```
real	7m37.738s
user	5m39.210s
sys	0m20.690s
root@ee9ff2ca0679:/app# time ./manage.py ingest push -p mozilla-central -r d6e40de88f3defdc12ef27e64ca73e120b1f10e2 -
```

You can set up the environment by running `docker-compose run backend bash` and you can then execute the command above.

I've asked for some feedback from coworkers and this is what they said:

* None of your tasks are running until you hit the gather on line 93.
* Consider using multiprocessing or concurrent futures for this. Sample example [here](https://github.com/mozilla/treeherder/blob/master/treeherder/perf/management/commands/import_perf_data.py)
  * Notice that multiprocessing is process level not thread level parallelism by default 
* [Project](https://github.com/encode/databases) which can be used for using databases asynchronously
  * I've used the async thread pool executor to handle db calls depending on your queries and DB configuration, the DB may need to serialize all your queries anyway

items.title: Upgrade to react-hotkeys
items.body: Upgrading `react-hot-keys` requires some work. When I landed it back in the day it broke the UI. [Manual test case #8](https://treeherder.readthedocs.io/testcases.html#treeherder) is the one that covers it.

items.title: link to worker from task details links to lists of workers for worker pool because url misses worker pool id
items.body:
From @Archaeopteryx in https://github.com/taskcluster/taskcluster/issues/1937

---

1. Go to Treeherder https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=mozilla-central&resultStatus=success%2Ctestfailed%2Cbusted%2Cexception&classifiedState=unclassified&searchStr=windows%2Cbuild
2. Click on a running or finished task.
3. At the bottom left, click on the task id link next to `Task`.
4. On the right, click on "More...".
5. Click on the "Worker ID".
Expected result: Lists of tasks machine had run opened, e.g. https://firefox-ci-tc.services.mozilla.com/provisioners/gecko-3/worker-types/b-win2012/workers/aws/i-0c3220d23d8fbef92
Actual result: List of workers for that provisioner opened: https://firefox-ci-tc.services.mozilla.com/provisioners/gecko-3/worker-types/b-win2012/workers/i-0c3220d23d8fbef92

The worker pool id `aws` is missing.

items.title: 404's fetching actions.json reported strangely
items.body: If a decision task's `actions.json` is not found, for example because the task exists in a different TC deployment or has expired, then TH seems to say "Wrong version of actions.json, unable to continue" which is a bit misleading.  I suspect this is happening because the fetch is not converting the 404 into a rejected Promise, but rather returning it as a regular response.  The code in `ui/models/taskcluster.js` then looks for `version` in this response, doesn't find it, and gives this error.

items.title: Remove ElasticSearch code
items.body:
Once upon a time we had an ElasticSearch add-on, however, we don't have it for a while.

Before you tackling this issue, check with me.
I'm waiting to see if someone will raise an objection in [here](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/mozilla.tools.treeherder/-Dgulh0-Tng).

You can see some of the code that will need removing in [here](https://github.com/mozilla/treeherder/search?q=ElasticSearch&type=Code).

items.title: Option collection values not honored, only keys
items.body:
In the various sample data, as well as in the json format comment in model/derived/jobs.py, option_collection on the job object is a dict, where keys like "opt" or "debug" can be True or False.

However, in model/derived/refdata.py, the option_collection is transformed into a set via set(option_collection), which loses all the vals and only keeps the keys. Upshot is "debug: false" still marks debug as it's brought into the set.

> > > d = {"Foo": False}
> > > sd = set(d)
> > > sd

set(['Foo'])

It would be best to either filter any False values out of the collection dict prior to transforming it, or to specify a list instead of dict for that value (as the default value for the jobs.py reader uses)

items.title: celery managemnt commands are not using the right log file
items.body:
Many celery commands (being spawned by supervisord via the `./bin/*` scripts) don't seem to be actually respecting their `--log-file` parameters.

To reproduce:

```
(venv)vagrant@precise32:~/treeherder-service$ pwd
/home/vagrant/treeherder-service
(venv)vagrant@precise32:~/treeherder-service$ rm -f treeherder.log
(venv)vagrant@precise32:~/treeherder-service$ ./bin/run_celerybeat 
^C
(venv)vagrant@precise32:~/treeherder-service$ ls treeherder.log 
treeherder.log
```

All the celery jobs seem to be creating this local `treeherder.log` file (they should be using whatevery `$LOGFILE` is in their `./bin/run_celery*` script)

I think @maurodoglio suggested that https://github.com/mozilla/treeherder-service/blob/master/treeherder/settings/base.py#L159 might be part of the issue.

items.title: Self Service Authentication
items.body:
What I propose is to use role based authentication + a hawk backend for clients. @jonasfj recently implemented a [simple auth server](http://docs.taskcluster.net/auth/api-docs/) on top of azure tables (we have a sec review going) and it includes a simple user interface to add clients.

A client would be granted a number of roles so it should be easier to provide granular access (as is done today) and more permissive access to multiple repos (and other capabilities later).

For example the current one-client-per repo would look like this:
- scope: ["treeherder-dev:repo:gaia-master"]

Multiple repos:
- scope: ["treeherder-dev:repo:gaia", "treeherder-dev:repo:gaia-master"]

All repos:
- scope: ["treeherder-dev:repo:gaia", "reeherder-dev:repo:*"]

items.title: Cannot run `init_master_db` twice?
items.body:
Maybe I should not be doing this at all ( I did in the past locally to clean out data) but running `init_master_db` seems to fail now with this error when run the second time:

```
 - Migrating forwards to 0002_auto__add_userexclusionprofile__add_exclusionprofile__add_jobexclusion.
 > model:0002_auto__add_userexclusionprofile__add_exclusionprofile__add_jobexclusion
FATAL ERROR - The following SQL query failed: CREATE TABLE `model_userexclusionprofile` (`id` integer AUTO_INCREMENT NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY, `user_id` integer NOT NULL, `exclusion_profile_id` integer NULL, `is_default` bool NOT NULL);
The error was: (1050, "Table 'model_userexclusionprofile' already exists")
 ! Error found during real run of migration! Aborting.

 ! Since you have a database that does not support running
 ! schema-altering statements in transactions, we have had 
 ! to leave it in an interim state between migrations.

! You *might* be able to recover with:   = DROP TABLE `model_userexclusionprofile` CASCADE; []
   = DROP TABLE `model_exclusionprofile` CASCADE; []
   = DROP TABLE `model_exclusionprofile_exclusions` CASCADE; []

Error in migration: model:0002_auto__add_userexclusionprofile__add_exclusionprofile__add_jobexclusion
DatabaseError: (1050, "Table 'model_userexclusionprofile' already exists")

```

items.title: Use json schema validation
items.body:
@jonasfj did some great work using json schema validation for the taskcluster ui (https://github.com/taskcluster/task-graph-scheduler/blob/master/schemas/scheduler/v1/create-task-graph-response.json)

I would suggest using json schema to validate at least input which would make treeherder errors much easier to diagnose and friendlier for third party consumers... Currently when I submit some data with missing keys/values (or unexpected types in those values) the errors are often very cryptic (or cause bugs in treeherder which we saw before)

items.title: Docker image
items.body:
Newer versions of vagrant can automatically create docker images based on whatever provisioning method you have... This might not seem super useful at first but its a _huge_ win to have a treeherder instance which can be spun up in 1s (usually less) and can be used for testing, etc... 

My particular use case is the integration points we have with taskcluster... it would be nice to have the ability to target a treeherder locally (which is easy to configure as a docker image) then the staging instance for our CI (to test our integration is working as expected).

The docker image could be published periodically (per commit?) via a simple hook.

items.title: Enable creating repositories as an API endpoint (returning credentials)
items.body:
To capture some of what was discussed today in a bug:
- There needs to be a way to automate the process of adding treeherder  "repositories" this is a very common periodic operation that happens across multiple tbpl visible projects (particularly for b2g). Getting the credentials for the newly created project should also be automated (returned).

The solution we discussed in the abstract looks like this:
- expose a new type of credential which allows creation of repositories
- return credentials for that new repository (the existing code path for today)

Related but not critical items that we discussed:
- How third party (someone other then who created X repository) can gain access to post to a particular repo in a self-service or automated way (no direct human intervention from the treeherder team)
- Leveraging @jonasfj 's in progress work for scoped authentications via hawk instead of the current oauth scheme (i.e. having each repo be a "role" or resource which multiple authorized clients can update). 

@jeads @camd

items.title: Using longer repository names breaks revision linking
items.body:
I should have tested the taskcluster-integration-tests name more throughly before submitting that earlier PR. While It does create the project without any problems I can't post resultsets to it. It appears that the repository_id is always zero in the project specific revision database.

Locally I just shortened the name so I can keep writing the tests... though it might make sense to validate this completely rather then just warn to avoid future problems with the name being too long.

items.title: Better control over revision links
items.body: Would it be possible to get more control over revision links? For pull requests the revisions live in the submitters repo not in gaia itself so urls. Not sure how easy this is but having direct access to just set the revision url would be ideal (github provides a html links by default so its really trivial to pass it)

items.title: option_collection without opts can break future job insertion
items.body:
When submitting jobs without option_collection.opts I noticed some errors like this:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/vagrant/treeherder-service/treeherder/webapp/api/views.py", line 126, in use_jobs_model
    return model_func(*args, jm=jm, **kwargs)
  File "/home/vagrant/treeherder-service/treeherder/webapp/api/views.py", line 332, in list
    job["option_collection_hash"]]['opt']
KeyError: u'da39a3ee5e6b4b0d3255bfef95601890afd80709
```

With the following job collection

``` js
[{
      "revision_hash": "...",
      "job": {
        "build_platform": {
          "platform": "2.2",
          "os_name": "android",
          "architecture": "ARMv7",
          "vm": false
        },
        "job_guid": '11111',
        "name": "Testing gaia",
        "reason": "scheduler",
        "job_symbol": "?",
        "submit_timestamp": 1387221298,
        "start_timestamp": 1387221345,
        "end_timestamp": 1387222817,
        "state": "pending",
        "log_references": [],
        "option_collection": {
        }
}]
```

Looks like this is caused by this: https://github.com/mozilla/treeherder-service/blob/master/treeherder/webapp/api/views.py#L325 which always seems to expect `.opt`

items.title: Structured log display is always empty
items.body:
http://treeherder-dev.allizom.org/ui/logviewer.html#?id=220303&repo=mozilla-inbound

Looking at the network log there is a request for http://treeherder-dev.allizom.org/api/project/undefined/artifact/220303/

I would guess the undefined part is a bug?
